name: aloft Portland Airport at Cascade Station

reviews.text: Hip hotel; modern, simple rooms. Liked the layout - not a big space but it felt like enough. Nice Bliss bathroom toiletries. They had live music on saturday night. cool scene. Free bottled water in the room- nice touch, never see that anymore.
reviews.title: Great value- trendy, fun hotel.

reviews.text: Two issues - they say on the website "leave your charger at home". So we did...I asked the front desk for an iphone charger and the front desk said "sorry, we don't have any. people leave chargers here but no one's left an iphone charger". I was confused because I thought it was a part of the sell that we wouldn't need to bring a charge. The other thing was that the mini fridge in the room never got cold. I put the water in there at night and then in the morning opened it expecting to have cold water but it was luke warm. I could hear the fan though- it must've been broken.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Just those two issues though - I would definitely stay there again - but I'll bring my charger.
reviews.title: There are frills, and there are no frills...

reviews.text: I always stay at the aloft hotel near the Portland Airport,easy access to shopping(across the street)You can get on the max rail an it takes you right into the city , so no worries about find a place to park. The hotel is nice an very quiet,only problem is it is showing some wear,carpet is starting to ripple in hallways etc,an seemed rooms weren't keep as nice as they once where.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Internet Issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall good place an I'll always stay there when traveling thru Portland.
reviews.title: established standing

reviews.text: Good location, near shopping. Very clean. The bed was large but so close to huge flat screen TV that it hurt to watch it. The lounge looked inviting but I had lots of work to complete so I did not get to enjoy it. Attended a conference at hotel.
reviews.title: Too hip??

reviews.text: This was the first time I had ever stayed at an aloft. What a cool experience. I felt like I was on South Beach.
reviews.title: Trendy, hip, cool, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: People were very pleasant, the rooms were clean, room service was good, and the hotel is very young and hip.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay and very close to airport

reviews.text: Not for the boring at heart. Otherwise, I highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Beautiful hotel (like most Alofts) and excellent service. Check in was easy, parking was free and the staff was very pleasant. The room was very clean and had everything we needed. Because it is near the airport the airplanes can be a little noisy. The front desk provides ear plugs.
reviews.title: Aloft is amazingly awesome and always my 1st choice

reviews.text: My son and I arrived around midnight after a long flight. We needed a hotel close to the airport. The hotel was fine, plenty of parking and the noise of the planes was not too bad when started flying again in the morning.
reviews.title: Predictably solid

reviews.text: Room was on the first floor just off the lobby. A strange location, but the doors and noise proofing was fine. The staff in the morning was much stronger than the staff at night.
reviews.title: Convenient, and kids loved it too.

reviews.text: BTW, there are not gas stations anywhere near the airport. if you have to fill up your rental car, do it before you get the airport. Apparently, there is some issue with the airport being on a flood plane that precludes gas stations from being on site. Great for rental car companies.
reviews.title: Easy Airport Location; Good Vibe; A Bit $$$

reviews.text: We needed a not-too-pricey overnight in Portland area and ended up at Aloft Cascade Station. Our 9 and 11 year olds were fans from the moment we stepped in the elevator and discovered the floor had panels of colored liquid that moved under pressure -- pretty fun. The pool was a hit. We enjoyed the outdoor patio between the bar and the pool -- adults could relax with a drink while kids swam.
reviews.title: Great Experience
Quiet, clean, friendly - and hip!
reviews.text: As we arrived, it was impressive seeing planes go right overhead on their approach to airport, but remarkably there was no sound at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a mid-range hotel, aloft feels vibrant and fresh. This hotel is located right near a train stop that goes to downtown Portland but is definitely an airport hotel. There's a free airport shuttle available 24 hours. Breakfast is not included but many a la carte choices are available in the lobby. The front desk is not really a front desk but feels more like an information desk at an airport - it's round.
reviews.title: Convenient & funky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby has a bar and live music on the Friday night that we were there. Some games are available too. The indoor pool looked lively. The hotel felt more active than most airport hotels.
reviews.title: Very convenient location, liked the modern theme, comfortable
Nice for disconnecting?
reviews.text: Rooms definitely have a European feel - shower has a frosted glass that borders the bedroom and bulk toiletries in dispensers on the wall. Comfortable furnishings that provide what you need for a night spent near the airport.

It was our first time in Portland, and all we really wanted to do was check out the city. We didn't want to rent a car, and we came upon this hotel online, as it is easily accessible via the light rail, straight from the airport. You can also easily get to downtown via the light rail as well ($5 for the whole day). Additionally, it's conveniently located next to stores like DSW, Best Buy, Bath & Body Works, etc. (hey, no sales tax!). And WOW! Burger, also nearby, has become my favorite burger place! So now back to the hotel. Friendly staff, pretty cool decor (it was modern, and provides a nice difference from your standard yawn-inducing hotel), a nice-sized room, comfortable bed (it is on the firm side, but that's how my husband and I like it), and a roomy shower stall with a nice big showerhead. It had the best rate when we looked at comparable hotels, and the complimentary airport shuttle was convenient as well. We're planning another trip to Portland in October with some friends, and we're most likely gonna stay here again.
reviews.title: Very good stay!

reviews.text: Everything was great except for the challenges with the WiFi and my laptop. It made working from the hotel a bit of a challenge. My iPad worked fine, but ran too slow to process some applications. I definitely prefer the vibe and location over the Embassy Suites. I loved the layout of the rooms...the huge windows and views were great. One window to watch landings and one to watch take offs. :)
reviews.title: Nice hotel but poor service

description: Our hotel just minutes away from Portland Airport and a quick trip to downtown too via the MAX line.
